We've all heard it told: "days get shorter in the Winter". But since today is the December Solstice, the first day of Winter and shortest day of the year (in the North), that means the days instead get **longer** in the Winter.

Just sayin'.

Dec 21, 2023
It’s that time of year again - December Solstice - with the least daylight (in the N. Hemisphere) and most daylight (in the S. Hemisphere).

As you might surmise, on Earth’s equator it’s equal night & day all year round. So residents there experience none of this.
